page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content:
{The Kent Estuary
{The River Kent} flows into {Morecambe {Bay}at Arnside along with the rivers{ {Bela}and{Winster.}The River Kent is the largest of these rivers and rises in the{Kentmere Valley}some 20 miles away north of{Kendal.}Until the building of the railway viaduct in the 1850's the river was navigable as far as{Milnthorpe}- the only port in the former County of{Westmorland.}Flax from Ireland was imported for the manufacture of twine. Iron ore and lime was exported from Arnside Knott for the Liverpool iron industry.
The rivers in the estuary are famous for salmon and trout fishing and for a small plaice-life fish know as a flook, flounder or flattie.
